sen.j: 杜澂（と ちょう、男性、寛延元年1748年 - 文化 (元号)13年5月13日 (旧暦)（1816年））は、日本の画家・篆刻家である。
sen.e: Tocho (male, 1784-May 13, 1816) was a Japanese painter and tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving).
Tocho (male, 1748-May 13, 1816) was a Japanese painter and tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving).
sen.cmt: 1784→誤訳のため1748に訂正しました。
sen.e: Tocho (male, 1748-May 13, 1816) was a Japanese painter and tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving).

sen.j: 中江姓。
sen.e: His family name was Nakae.
His family name was Nakae.
His family name was Nakae.

sen.j: 字を澂公・師叔、号 (称号)に松窠・華亭・看雲子・五適・琴史・陶古・真賞斎などがある。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) were 澂公 and 師叔, his second name or alias included 松窠, 華亭, 看雲子, 五適, 琴史, 陶古 and 真賞斎.
His azana (adult male's nickname) were Choko and 師叔, his second names or aliases included Shoka, Katei, 看雲子, Goteki, 琴史, 陶古 and 真賞斎.
sen.cmt: 松窠→Shokaに訂正しました。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%B8%AD%E6%B1%9F%E6%9D%BE%E7%AA%A0参照しました。澂公→Choko、華亭→Katei、五適→Gotekiに訂正しました。http://www.tulips.tsukuba.ac.jp/jart/mokuji/2sk004.html参照しました。his second name or alias→複数形に訂正しました。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) were Choko and 師叔, his second names or aliases included Shoka, Katei, 看雲子, Goteki, 琴史, 陶古 and 真賞斎.

sen.j: 京都の人。
sen.e: He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief biography
Brief biography
Brief biography

sen.j: 京都で黄檗宗となったが、還俗し中江姓に復する。
sen.e: He came to believe in the Obaku sect of Buddhism in Kyoto, but he returned to secular life and changed his name back to Nakae.
He came to believe in the Obaku sect of Buddhism in Kyoto, but he returned to secular life and changed his name back to Nakae.
He came to believe in the Obaku sect of Buddhism in Kyoto, but he returned to secular life and changed his name back to Nakae.

sen.j: 琴・書・漢詩・文人画・篆刻に堪能であったことから五適と称した。
sen.e: Since he was good at koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings), calligraphy, Chinese poetry, literati painting and tenkoku (seal-engraving), he was referred to as 五適.
Since he was good at koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings), calligraphy, Chinese poetry, literati painting and tenkoku (seal-engraving), he was referred to as Goteki.
sen.cmt: 五適→Gotekiに訂正しました。http://www.tulips.tsukuba.ac.jp/jart/mokuji/2sk004.html参照しました。
sen.e: Since he was good at koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings), calligraphy, Chinese poetry, literati painting and tenkoku (seal-engraving), he was referred to as Goteki.

sen.j: 琴は心越の流れを汲む空々（宿谷黙甫）の門下となった。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Kuku (宿谷黙甫) who follow the style of Shinetsu for learning koto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「宿谷黙甫」は読み方不明。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Kuku (宿谷黙甫) who followed the style of Shinetsu for learning koto.
sen.cmt: follow→followedに時制を訂正しました。「宿谷黙甫」は読み方の確認取れませんでした。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Kuku (宿谷黙甫) who followed the style of Shinetsu for learning koto.

sen.j: 画は江戸にて宗紫石の門人董九如（西丸扈従）に学ぶ。
sen.e: He learned painting in Edo under Kyujo TO (西丸扈従) who was a disciple of Shiseki SO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「西丸扈従」は読み方不明。
sen.e: He learned painting in Edo under Kyujo TO (西丸扈従) who was a disciple of Shiseki SO.
He learned painting in Edo under Kyujo TO (西丸扈従) who was a disciple of Shiseki SO.

sen.j: 書と篆刻は細井広沢の門人雪庵（曇華）に学び、書は阮西園にも師事している。
sen.e: He studied calligraphy and tenkoku under 雪庵 (Donge) who was a disciple of Kotaku HOSOI, and also learned calligraphy from 阮西園.
He studied calligraphy and tenkoku under 雪庵 (Donge) who was a disciple of Kotaku HOSOI, and also learned calligraphy from 阮西園.
He studied calligraphy and tenkoku under 雪庵 (Donge) who was a disciple of Kotaku HOSOI, and also learned calligraphy from 阮西園.

sen.j: 長崎では来舶人の龔允譲に詩・書を教えられた。
sen.e: In Nagasaki, he learned poetry and calligraphy from 龔允譲, a foreigner.
In Nagasaki, he learned poetry and calligraphy from 龔允譲, a foreigner.
In Nagasaki, he learned poetry and calligraphy from 龔允譲, a foreigner.

sen.j: 江戸に一時住み、母を連れ立って越後に遊歴。
sen.e: He temporarily lived in Edo, and toured to Echigo with his mother.
He temporarily lived in Edo, and toured to Echigo with his mother.
He temporarily lived in Edo, and toured to Echigo with his mother.

sen.j: 越後には出雲崎町を中心に10年以上滞在した。
sen.e: He stayed in Echigo, mainly in Izumozaki Town, for more than ten years.
He stayed in Echigo, mainly in Izumozaki Town, for more than ten years.
He stayed in Echigo, mainly in Izumozaki Town, for more than ten years.

sen.j: その間、釧雲泉とは昵懇となる。
sen.e: During that time, he became close to Unzen KUSHIRO.
During that time, he became close to Unzen KUSHIRO.
During that time, he became close to Unzen KUSHIRO.

sen.j: 寛政4年、母死去。
sen.e: In 1792, his mother died.
In 1792, his mother died.
In 1792, his mother died.

sen.j: 翌年、高田市で一日百印会を催す。
sen.e: Next year, 一日百印会 was held in Takada City.
Next year, 一日百印会 was held in Takada City.
Next year, 一日百印会 was held in Takada City.

sen.j: 滞在先の橘屋は良寛の出た名家である。
sen.e: Tachibanaya, where he stayed, was an important family from where Ryokan was born.
Tachibanaya, where he stayed, was an important family from where Ryokan was born.
Tachibanaya, where he stayed, was an important family from where Ryokan was born.

sen.j: 享年69。
sen.e: Died at the age of 69.
Died at the age of 69.
Died at the age of 69.

sen.j: 越後出雲崎浄玄寺に葬られる。
sen.e: He was buried in Jogen-ji Temple in Izumozaki Town, Echigo Province.
He was buried in Jogen-ji Temple in Izumozaki Town, Echigo Province.
He was buried in Jogen-ji Temple in Izumozaki Town, Echigo Province.

sen.j: 法名 (浄土真宗)松窠庵釈化雲。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was 松窠庵釈化雲 (Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism)).
sen.cmt: 「松窠庵釈化雲」は読み方不明。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was 松窠庵釈化雲 (Jodo Shinshu [the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism]).
sen.cmt: (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism)→()を[]に訂正しました。「松窠庵釈化雲」は読み方の確認取れませんでした。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was 松窠庵釈化雲 (Jodo Shinshu [the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism]).

sen.j: 墓石は崖崩れで紛失した。
sen.e: The gravestone was lost by a cliff failure.
The gravestone was lost by a cliff failure.
The gravestone was lost by a cliff failure.

sen.j: なお、富取益斎の『印章備正』は杜澂の『澂古印要』の写しである。
sen.e: "Insho Bisei" by Ekisai TOMITORI was a copy of "Chokoinyo" by Tocho.
"Insho Bisei" by Ekisai TOMITORI was a copy of "Chokoinyo" by Tocho.
"Insho Bisei" by Ekisai TOMITORI was a copy of "Chokoinyo" by Tocho.

sen.j: 著作
sen.e: Literary work
Literary work
Literary work

sen.j: 『施刻一日百章』
sen.e: "施刻一日百章"
"施刻一日百章"
"施刻一日百章"

sen.j: 『澂古印要』7巻 天明2年
sen.e: "Chokoinyo" Volume 7 (1782)
"Chokoinyo" Volume 7 (1782)
"Chokoinyo" Volume 7 (1782)

sen.j: 『澂古画伝』3巻 序文：海保青陵
sen.e: "Chokogaden" Volume 3 Preface: Seiryo KAIHO
"Chokogaden" Volume 3 Preface: Seiryo KAIHO
"Chokogaden" Volume 3 Preface: Seiryo KAIHO

sen.j: 『倭奴国金印考』 跋文：阮西園
sen.e: "倭奴国金印考" Afterword: 阮西園
sen.cmt: 「倭奴国金印考」は読み方不明。
sen.e: "倭奴国金印考" Afterword: 阮西園
"倭奴国金印考" Afterword: 阮西園

sen.j: 『琴伝の説』
sen.e: "琴伝の説"
"琴伝の説"
"琴伝の説"
